009package imagingbook.spectral.dft;
010
011import java.util.Arrays;
012
013import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
016
017/**
018 * Two-dimensional DFT implementation.
019 * @author WB
020 *
021 */
022public abstract class Dft2d {
023        
024        final ScalingMode sm;
025        boolean useFastMode = true;
026        
027        public void useFastMode(boolean yesOrNo) {
028                this.useFastMode = yesOrNo;
029        }
030        
031        private Dft2d() {
032                this(ScalingMode.DEFAULT);
033        }
034        
035        private Dft2d(ScalingMode sm) {
036                this.sm = sm;
037        }
038        
039        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
040        
041        public static class Float extends Dft2d {
042                
043                /**
044                 * Performs an "in-place" 2D DFT forward transformation on the supplied data.
045                 * The input signal is replaced by the associated DFT spectrum.
046                 * @param gRe real part of the signal (modified)
047                 * @param gIm imaginary part of the signal (modified)
048                 */
049                public void forward(float[][] gRe, float[][] gIm) {
050                        checkSize(gRe, gIm);
051                        transform(gRe, gIm, true);
052                }
053                
054                /**
055                 * Performs an "in-place" 2D DFT inverse transformation on the supplied spectrum.
056                 * The input spectrum is replaced by the associated signal.
057                 * @param GRe real part of the spectrum (modified)
058                 * @param GIm imaginary part of the spectrum (modified)
059                 */
060                public void inverse(float[][] GRe, float[][] GIm) {
061                        checkSize(GRe, GIm);
062                        transform(GRe, GIm, false);
063                }
064                
065                /**
066                 * Transforms the given 2D arrays 'in-place'. Separate arrays of identical size
067                 * must be supplied for the real and imaginary parts of the signal (forward) 
068                 * or spectrum (inverse), neither of which may be null.
069                 * 
070                 * @param inRe real part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
071                 * @param inIm imaginary part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
072                 * @param forward forward transformation if {@code true}, inverse transformation if {@code false}
073                 */
074                void transform(float[][] inRe, float[][] inIm, boolean forward) {
075                        final int width = inRe.length;
076                        final int height = inRe[0].length;
077
078                        // transform each row (in place):
079                        final float[] rowRe = new float[width];
080                        final float[] rowIm = new float[width];
081                        Dft1d.Float dftRow = 
082                                        useFastMode ? new Dft1dFast.Float(width, sm) : new Dft1dDirect.Float(width, sm);
083                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
084                                extractRow(inRe, v, rowRe);
085                                extractRow(inIm, v, rowIm);
086                                dftRow.transform(rowRe, rowIm, forward);
087                                insertRow(inRe, v, rowRe);
088                                insertRow(inIm, v, rowIm);
089                        }
090
091                        // transform each column (in place):
092                        final float[] colRe = new float[height];
093                        final float[] colIm = new float[height];
094                        Dft1d.Float dftCol = 
095                                        useFastMode ? new Dft1dFast.Float(height, sm) : new Dft1dDirect.Float(height, sm);
096                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
097                                extractCol(inRe, u, colRe);
098                                extractCol(inIm, u, colIm);
099                                dftCol.transform(colRe, colIm, forward);
100                                insertCol(inRe, u, colRe);
101                                insertCol(inIm, u, colIm);
102                        }
103                }
104                
105                // extract the values of row 'v' of 'g' into 'row'
106                private void extractRow(float[][] g, int v, float[] row) {
107                        if (g == null) {                        // TODO: check if needed
108                                Arrays.fill(row, 0);
109                        }
110                        else {
111                                for (int u = 0; u < row.length; u++) {
112                                        row[u] = g[u][v];
113                                }
114                        }
115                }
116
117                // insert 'row' into row 'v' of 'g'
118                private void insertRow(float[][] g, int v, float[] row) {
119                        for (int u = 0; u < row.length; u++) {
120                                g[u][v] = row[u];
121                        }
122                }
123
124                // extract the values of column 'u' of 'g' into 'cols'
125                private void extractCol(float[][] g, int u, float[] col) {
126                        if (g == null) {                        // TODO: check if needed
127                                Arrays.fill(col, 0);
128                        }
129                        else {
130                                for (int v = 0; v < col.length; v++) {
131                                        col[v] = g[u][v];
132                                }
133                        }
134                }
135
136                // insert 'col' into column 'u' of 'g'
137                private void insertCol(float[][] g, final int u, float[] col) {
138                        for (int v = 0; v < col.length; v++) {
139                                g[u][v] = col[v];
140                        }
141                }
142                
143                /**
144                 * Calculates and returns the magnitude of the supplied complex-valued 2D data.
145                 * @param re the real part of the data
146                 * @param im the imaginary part of the data
147                 * @return a 2D array of magnitude values
148                 */
149                public float[][] getMagnitude(float[][] re, float[][] im) {
150                        checkSize(re, im);
151                        final int width = re.length;
152                        final int height = re[0].length;
153                        float[][] mag = new float[width][height];
154                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
155                                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
156                                        float a = re[u][v];
157                                        float b = im[u][v];
158                                        mag[u][v] = (float) Math.sqrt(a*a + b*b);
159                                }
160                        }
161                        return mag;
162                }
163                
164                private void checkSize(float[][] re, float[][] im) {
165                        if (!Matrix.sameSize(re, im))
166                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("arrays for real/imagingary parts must be of same size");
167                }
168                
169        }
170        
171        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
172        
173        public static class Double extends Dft2d {
174                
175
176                public void forward(double[][] gRe, double[][] gIm) {
177                        checkSize(gRe, gIm);
178                        transform(gRe, gIm, true);
179                }
180                
181                public void inverse(double[][] GRe, double[][] GIm) {
182                        checkSize(GRe, GIm);
183                        transform(GRe, GIm, false);
184                }
185                
186                /**
187                 * Transforms the given 2D arrays 'in-place', i.e., real and imaginary
188                 * arrays of identical size must be supplied, neither may be null.
189                 * 
190                 * @param gRe
191                 * @param gIm
192                 * @param forward
193                 */
194                void transform(double[][] gRe, double[][] gIm, boolean forward) {
195                        final int width = gRe.length;
196                        final int height = gRe[0].length;
197
198                        // transform each row (in place):
199                        final double[] rowRe = new double[width];
200                        final double[] rowIm = new double[width];
201                        Dft1d.Double dftRow = 
202                                        useFastMode ? new Dft1dFast.Double(width, sm) : new Dft1dDirect.Double(width, sm);
203                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
204                                extractRow(gRe, v, rowRe);
205                                extractRow(gIm, v, rowIm);
206                                dftRow.transform(rowRe, rowIm, forward);
207                                insertRow(gRe, v, rowRe);
208                                insertRow(gIm, v, rowIm);
209                        }
210
211                        // transform each column (in place):
212                        final double[] colRe = new double[height];
213                        final double[] colIm = new double[height];
214                        Dft1d.Double dftCol = 
215                                        useFastMode ? new Dft1dFast.Double(height, sm) : new Dft1dDirect.Double(height, sm);
216                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
217                                extractCol(gRe, u, colRe);
218                                extractCol(gIm, u, colIm);
219                                dftCol.transform(colRe, colIm, forward);
220                                insertCol(gRe, u, colRe);
221                                insertCol(gIm, u, colIm);
222                        }
223                }
224                
225                // extract the values of row 'v' of 'g' into 'row'
226                private void extractRow(double[][] g, int v, double[] row) {
227                        if (g == null) {                        // TODO: check if needed
228                                Arrays.fill(row, 0);
229                        }
230                        else {
231                                for (int u = 0; u < row.length; u++) {
232                                        row[u] = g[u][v];
233                                }
234                        }
235                }
236
237                // insert 'row' into row 'v' of 'g'
238                private void insertRow(double[][] g, int v, double[] row) {
239                        for (int u = 0; u < row.length; u++) {
240                                g[u][v] = row[u];
241                        }
242                }
243
244                // extract the values of column 'u' of 'g' into 'cols'
245                private void extractCol(double[][] g, int u, double[] col) {
246                        if (g == null) {                        // TODO: check if needed
247                                Arrays.fill(col, 0);
248                        }
249                        else {
250                                for (int v = 0; v < col.length; v++) {
251                                        col[v] = g[u][v];
252                                }
253                        }
254                }
255
256                // insert 'col' into column 'u' of 'g'
257                private void insertCol(double[][] g, final int u, double[] col) {
258                        for (int v = 0; v < col.length; v++) {
259                                g[u][v] = col[v];
260                        }
261                }
262                
263                /**
264                 * Calculates and returns the magnitude of the supplied complex-valued 2D data.
265                 * @param re the real part of the data
266                 * @param im the imaginary part of the data
267                 * @return a 2D array of magnitude values
268                 */
269                public double[][] getMagnitude(double[][] re, double[][] im) {
270                        checkSize(re, im);
271                        final int width = re.length;
272                        final int height = re[0].length;
273                        double[][] mag = new double[width][height];
274                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
275                                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
276                                        double a = re[u][v];
277                                        double b = im[u][v];
278                                        mag[u][v] = Math.sqrt(a*a + b*b);
279                                }
280                        }
281                        return mag;
282                }
283                
284                private void checkSize(double[][] re, double[][] im) {
285                        if (!Matrix.sameSize(re, im))
286                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("arrays for real/imagingary parts must be of same size");
287                }
288                
289        }
290        
291        /**
292         * Static utility method for centering a 2D DFT spectrum.
293         * Modifies the given image by moving the origin of the image to its center
294         * (circularly).
295         * TODO: Check for possible bug when applied to a {@link FloatProcessor}!
296         * 
297         * @param ip an {@link ImageProcessor} instance
298         */
299        public static void swapQuadrants(ImageProcessor ip) {
300                // swap quadrants Q1 <-> Q3, Q2 <-> Q4
301                // Q2 Q1
302                // Q3 Q4
303                ImageProcessor t1, t2;
304                int w = ip.getWidth();
305                int h = ip.getHeight();
306                int wc = w / 2;
307                int hc = h / 2;
308
309                ip.setRoi(wc, 0, w - wc, hc); // Q1
310                t1 = ip.crop();
311                ip.setRoi(0, hc, wc, h - hc); // Q3
312                t2 = ip.crop();
313
314                ip.insert(t1, 0, hc); // swap Q1 <-> Q3
315                ip.insert(t2, wc, 0);
316
317                ip.setRoi(0, 0, wc, hc); // Q2
318                t1 = ip.crop();
319                ip.setRoi(wc, hc, w - wc, h - hc); // Q4
320                t2 = ip.crop();
321
322                ip.insert(t1, wc, hc);
323                ip.insert(t2, 0, 0);
324        }
325
326}
